result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Michael Pleadwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Orlando Michael Pleadwell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Orlando Michael Pleadwell was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: With huber privileges.  Jail to commence on or before Nov. 28, 2016 unless states otherwise.  May transfer to Dane Co.

Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent. Write an apology letter to the victim and family - at least 2 pages long & approved by agent before sending.  AODA/treatment per agent.   ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Judgment/Notice of Entry of Judgment  (remailed to new address as provided by the mail service/US Postal Service)
of restitution

Defendant Orlando Michael Pleadwell in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:

4 years Probation
90 days jail, with work release/child care commence on or before November 28, 2016, no later than 6:30 p.m.
May transfer to Dane County per jail rules
Provide DNA surcharge/sample
Provide 40 hours of community service per year at least some of it to provided in the Wisconsin Dells area.  1/4 must be related to the juvenile diabetes or some other diabetes entity.
Write an apology letter to the victim and her family - at least 2 pages long and approved by agent before sending.
Undergo any counseling per agent
AODA & treatment
$10,000.00 Restitution with 15% Surcharge To:  (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS)
$518.00 Fine/Costs fees (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
Paperwork handed in court.
Sentencing hearing on October 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe notes DE's father's car wouldn't start today.  Call from DE at 11:50 today stating he had no other way to get here.  Requests reset of SEH.  State notes the victim still wishes to appear.  Victim had planned to appear by phone today but that's been set back since DE couldn't be here.  Requests two week reset for everyone.  Bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Restitution stipulation
Sentencing hearing on September 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Orlando Michael Pleadwell in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states recommendations.  State moves to withdraw the repeater.  Court notes problem w/expungment.  Atty Raabe notes they will proceed w/o the expungment agreement.  Court grants State's motion to remove the repeater enhancement on Ct 1.  Atty Raabe agrees w/recommendations as stated by State.  DE also agrees re: expungment issue.  Atty Raabe enters NC plea to Ct 1.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Parties review VIS.  State makes statement re: recommendations.  Atty Raabe makes statement on behalf of DE.  State notes that the victim has said she would like to speak at sentencing, but she has not appeared today even though she was noticed of today's hearing.  Court requests next Monday for sentencing.  State will let victim witness know.  Court sets sentencing over the 9/12/2016 at 1pm.  Atty Raabe will further address restitution on 9/12 also.  Bond continued.

Ct 1:  NC - w/o repeater enhancement
Probation for 4 years
Conditions of probation:
90 days jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
To commence on or before 11/5/2016 at 6:30 pm
May serve in Dane Co if accepted
$20,233.21 restitution plus surcharges per stipulation
$518.00 costs/surcharges to be paid w/in 60 days to Clerk of Court's Office or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided
Ct 2:  Dismissed  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on September 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on September 6, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Orlando Michael Pleadwell in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe requests prelim.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 11:15 am.  Court reviews file and matter will be placed back on the JT calendar.

Pre-trial conference on June 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Return date on June 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Orlando Michael Pleadwell in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Raabe request new PTC/Rd.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on May 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Atty Raabe states he has not heard from his client but was just appointed and is requesting a continuance as he cannot be ready for JT as scheduled.  Court authorizes warrant but stays it for one week.  State requests JT be called off so victim can be notified.  Court cancels JT but DE must appear on 5/16 or the warrant will issue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on May 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on May 9, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Orlando Michael Pleadwell in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter had been resolved and now not resolved after meeting this morning.  Put back on trial calendar.  Additional count w/repeaters will be added then.  Court will set for trial again soon.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 30, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states recv'd a call from DE and couldn't make it today, ride didn't show.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stayed until day and time to be set for plea.  Get plea/sentencing from Br. 3.
Jury trial at 03-22-2016 08:30 am
